court: IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY IN ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION OFFCIAL ASSIGNEE'S REPORT DT.18TH NOVEMBER, 2006 IN PETITION NO.15 OF 1975 Re: P. R. Mulay
judgment_text:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY IN ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION OFFCIAL ASSIGNEE'S REPORT DT.18TH NOVEMBER, 2006 IN PETITION NO.15 OF 1975 Re: P. R. Mulay

..Insolvent. Ex-parte: Diners Club (India) Pvt. Limited ..Petitioning Creditor. ... Mr. Y.C. Parikh, Official Assignee present. CORAM: DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD, J. 21st November, 2006. P.C. : An order of adjudication was passed on 21st July, 1976. The schedule of assets and liabilities was filed by the Insolvent on th June, 1977. On 4th July, 1995 an order of annulment of insolvency was passed under Section 21(1) of the Presidency Towns Insolvency Act, 1909. At present Rs.578.86 is lying to the credit of the estate account. The Official Assignee has prayed that this amount may be transferred to the unclaimed dividend capital account under Rule 178 of the Bombay Insolvency Rules, and thereafter to the unclaimed dividend capital revenue account and the account may be closed for administrative purposes. Having regard to the circumstances set out in the report of the Official Assignee, there is no reason why the prayer should not be granted. Prayer clause (a) of the report of the Official Assignee is accordingly granted.
reasoning: Sentence-ensemble voted {'allowed': ["rule:1.00:'Prayer clause (a) of the report of the Official Assignee is accordingly granted....'"]}
